alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern West Baton Rouge, central Iberville and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 415 PM CDT... At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Addis, or near Plaquemine, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Plaquemine, Port Allen, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, Rosedale, Grosse Tete and Gardere. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 139 and 149, and between mile markers 151 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
